summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and contractors regarding the preparation of a supplemental discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails discuss stamping documents, converting video/audio files, and drafting a cover letter in response to a letter from Everdell.

persons.name: Everdell
persons.context: Mentioned as the sender of a recent letter to which the prosecution team needs to respond in their discovery cover letter.

connections.description: M is tasked with handling cover letter revisions to include a response to Everdell's recent letter, indicating a legal adversarial or procedural relationship.

events.title: Discovery Production Preparation
events.description: USANYS team and contractors finalize a supplemental discovery production for the Maxwell case, including stamping documents and converting video/audio files.

events.title: Advance Notice of Discovery Materials
events.description: The prosecution team provides advance notice of supplemental discovery materials, including problematic audio files, to be produced after a superseding indictment.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing a supplemental discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case in April 2021.
The discovery materials included PBPD surveillance video footage and American Express (Amex) records that required conversion to usable formats.
The prosecution team planned to respond to a letter from attorney Everdell in their discovery cover letter.
The email chain highlights the logistical efforts involved in managing large-scale discovery, including document stamping and file format conversion.
